Mother of the Bride is an upcoming American romantic comedy film directed by Mark Waters and written by Robin Bernheim. It stars Brooke Shields, Miranda Cosgrove, and Benjamin Bratt.
The film is scheduled to be released on Netflix on May 9, 2024.


Premise[edit]
After a year abroad in London, Emma returns home and stuns her mother Lana with the news that she's getting married in a month at a resort in Phuket, Thailand. Things get worse when Lana discovers that the husband-to-be is the son of the man who broke her heart years earlier.

Michael McDonald as Clay
Tasneem Roc as Camala
Dalip Sondhi as Harley
Production[edit]
In February 2023, Netflix announced a romantic comedy film written by Robin Bernheim and to be directed by Mark Waters was in pre-production. Brooke Shields, Miranda Cosgrove, Benjamin Bratt, Chad Michael Murray, Rachael Harris, Sean Teale, Wilson Cruz, Michael McDonald, Tasneem Roc, and Dalip Sondhi was added to the cast.[3][4] Principal photography began in April 2023 in Phuket, Thailand.[5][6]

Release[edit]
Mother of the Bride is scheduled to be released on Netflix on May 9, 2024.[7]
